intro: Silene tilingii, commonly known as the Tilingii campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Silene tilingii has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
